service:
The Amazon Q Apps feature capability within Amazon Q Business allows web experience users to create lightweight, purpose-built AI apps to fulfill specific tasks from within their web experience. For example, users can create a Q App that exclusively generates marketing-related content to improve your marketing team's productivity or a Q App for writing customer emails and creating promotional content using a certain style of voice, tone, and branding. For more information on the capabilities, see Amazon Q Apps capabilities in the Amazon Q Business User Guide.

For an overview of the Amazon Q App APIs, see Overview of Amazon Q Apps API operations.

For information about the IAM access control permissions you need to use the Amazon Q Apps API, see IAM role for the Amazon Q Business web experience including Amazon Q Apps in the Amazon Q Business User Guide.

operations.AssociateLibraryItemReview: Associates a rating or review for a library item with the user submitting the request. This increments the rating count for the specified library item.
operations.AssociateQAppWithUser: This operation creates a link between the user's identity calling the operation and a specific Q App. This is useful to mark the Q App as a favorite for the user if the user doesn't own the Amazon Q App so they can still run it and see it in their inventory of Q Apps.
operations.BatchCreateCategory: Creates Categories for the Amazon Q Business application environment instance. Web experience users use Categories to tag and filter library items. For more information, see Custom labels for Amazon Q Apps.
operations.BatchDeleteCategory: Deletes Categories for the Amazon Q Business application environment instance. Web experience users use Categories to tag and filter library items. For more information, see Custom labels for Amazon Q Apps.
operations.BatchUpdateCategory: Updates Categories for the Amazon Q Business application environment instance. Web experience users use Categories to tag and filter library items. For more information, see Custom labels for Amazon Q Apps.
operations.CreateLibraryItem: Creates a new library item for an Amazon Q App, allowing it to be discovered and used by other allowed users.
operations.CreatePresignedUrl:
Creates a presigned URL for an S3 POST operation to upload a file. You can use this URL to set a default file for a FileUploadCard in a Q App definition or to provide a file for a single Q App run. The scope parameter determines how the file will be used, either at the app definition level or the app session level.

The IAM permissions are derived from the qapps:ImportDocument action. For more information on the IAM policy for Amazon Q Apps, see IAM permissions for using Amazon Q Apps.
operations.CreateQApp: Creates a new Amazon Q App based on the provided definition. The Q App definition specifies the cards and flow of the Q App. This operation also calculates the dependencies between the cards by inspecting the references in the prompts.
operations.DeleteLibraryItem: Deletes a library item for an Amazon Q App, removing it from the library so it can no longer be discovered or used by other users.
operations.DeleteQApp: Deletes an Amazon Q App owned by the user. If the Q App was previously published to the library, it is also removed from the library.
operations.DescribeQAppPermissions: Describes read permissions for a Amazon Q App in Amazon Q Business application environment instance.
operations.DisassociateLibraryItemReview: Removes a rating or review previously submitted by the user for a library item.
operations.DisassociateQAppFromUser: Disassociates a Q App from a user removing the user's access to run the Q App.
operations.ExportQAppSessionData: Exports the collected data of a Q App data collection session.
operations.GetLibraryItem: Retrieves details about a library item for an Amazon Q App, including its metadata, categories, ratings, and usage statistics.
operations.GetQApp: Retrieves the full details of an Q App, including its definition specifying the cards and flow.
operations.GetQAppSession: Retrieves the current state and results for an active session of an Amazon Q App.
operations.GetQAppSessionMetadata: Retrieves the current configuration of a Q App session.
operations.ImportDocument: Uploads a file that can then be used either as a default in a FileUploadCard from Q App definition or as a file that is used inside a single Q App run. The purpose of the document is determined by a scope parameter that indicates whether it is at the app definition level or at the app session level.
operations.ListCategories: Lists the categories of a Amazon Q Business application environment instance. For more information, see Custom labels for Amazon Q Apps.
operations.ListLibraryItems: Lists the library items for Amazon Q Apps that are published and available for users in your Amazon Web Services account.
operations.ListQAppSessionData: Lists the collected data of a Q App data collection session.
operations.ListQApps: Lists the Amazon Q Apps owned by or associated with the user either because they created it or because they used it from the library in the past. The user identity is extracted from the credentials used to invoke this operation..
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists the tags associated with an Amazon Q Apps resource.
operations.PredictQApp: Generates an Amazon Q App definition based on either a conversation or a problem statement provided as input.The resulting app definition can be used to call CreateQApp. This API doesn't create Amazon Q Apps directly.
operations.StartQAppSession:
Starts a new session for an Amazon Q App, allowing inputs to be provided and the app to be run.

Each Q App session will be condensed into a single conversation in the web experience.
operations.StopQAppSession: Stops an active session for an Amazon Q App.This deletes all data related to the session and makes it invalid for future uses. The results of the session will be persisted as part of the conversation.
operations.TagResource: Associates tags with an Amazon Q Apps resource.
operations.UntagResource: Disassociates tags from an Amazon Q Apps resource.
operations.UpdateLibraryItem: Updates the library item for an Amazon Q App.
operations.UpdateLibraryItemMetadata: Updates the verification status of a library item for an Amazon Q App.
operations.UpdateQApp: Updates an existing Amazon Q App, allowing modifications to its title, description, and definition.
operations.UpdateQAppPermissions: Updates read permissions for a Amazon Q App in Amazon Q Business application environment instance.
operations.UpdateQAppSession: Updates the session for a given Q App sessionId. This is only valid when at least one card of the session is in the WAITING state. Data for each WAITING card can be provided as input. If inputs are not provided, the call will be accepted but session will not move forward. Inputs for cards that are not in the WAITING status will be ignored.
operations.UpdateQAppSessionMetadata: Updates the configuration metadata of a session for a given Q App sessionId.

AccessDeniedException.base: The client is not authorized to perform the requested operation.

refs.QPluginCard$actionIdentifier: The action identifier of the action to be performed by the plugin card.
refs.QPluginCardInput$actionIdentifier: The action identifier of the action to be performed by the plugin card.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$resourceARN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource whose tags should be listed.
refs.TagResourceRequest$resourceARN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to tag.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$resourceARN: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to disassociate the tag from.

refs.CreateQAppOutput$appArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the new Q App.
refs.GetQAppOutput$appArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Q App.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$appArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the updated Q App.
refs.UserAppItem$appArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Q App.

AppDefinition.base: The definition of the Q App, specifying the cards and flow.

refs.GetQAppOutput$appDefinition: The full definition of the Q App, specifying the cards and flow.

AppDefinitionInput.base: The input for defining an Q App.

refs.CreateQAppInput$appDefinition: The definition of the new Q App, specifying the cards and flow.
refs.PredictAppDefinition$appDefinition: The definition specifying the cards and flow of the generated Q App.
refs.UpdateQAppInput$appDefinition: The new definition specifying the cards and flow for the Q App.

refs.CreateQAppOutput$requiredCapabilities: The capabilities required to run the Q App, such as file upload or third-party integrations.
refs.GetQAppOutput$requiredCapabilities: The capabilities required to run the Q App, such as file upload or third-party integrations.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$requiredCapabilities: The capabilities required for the updated Q App.

refs.CreateQAppOutput$status: The status of the new Q App, such as "Created".
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$status: The status of the updated Q App.

refs.CreateLibraryItemInput$appVersion: The version of the Amazon Q App to publish to the library.
refs.CreateQAppOutput$appVersion: The version of the new Q App.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$appVersion: The version of the Q App associated with the library item.
refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$appVersion: The version of the Q App used for the session.
refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$latestPublishedAppV: The latest published version of the Q App used for the session.
refs.LibraryItemMember$appVersion: The version of the Q App associated with the library item.
refs.StartQAppSessionInput$appVersion: The version of the Q App to use for the session.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$appVersion: The version of the Q App associated with the library item.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$appVersion: The new version of the updated Q App.

AttributeFilter.base: The filter criteria used on responses based on document attributes or metadata fields.

refs.AttributeFilter$notFilter: Performs a logical NOT operation on all supplied filters.
refs.QQueryCard$attributeFilter: The Amazon Q Business filters applied in this query card when resolving data sources
refs.QQueryCardInput$attributeFilter: Turns on filtering of responses based on document attributes or metadata fields.

refs.AttributeFilter$andAllFilters: Performs a logical AND operation on all supplied filters.
refs.AttributeFilter$orAllFilters: Performs a logical OR operation on all supplied filters.

refs.BatchCreateCategoryInputCategory$color: The color to be associated with a category. The color must be a hexadecimal value of either 3 or 6 digits.

refs.BatchCreateCategoryInput$categories: The list of category objects to be created

refs.AppDefinition$canEdit: A flag indicating whether the Q App's definition can be edited by the user.
refs.CreateLibraryItemOutput$isVerified: Indicates whether the library item has been verified.
refs.FileUploadCard$allowOverride: A flag indicating if the user can override the default file for the upload card.
refs.FileUploadCardInput$allowOverride: A flag indicating if the user can override the default file for the upload card.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$isRatedByUser: Whether the current user has rated the library item.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$isVerified: Indicates whether the library item has been verified.
refs.GetQAppSessionMetadataOutput$sessionOwne: Indicates whether the current user is the owner of the Q App session.
refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$userIsHost: Indicates whether the current user is the owner of the Q App data collection session.
refs.LibraryItemMember$isRatedByUser: Whether the current user has rated the library item.
refs.LibraryItemMember$isVerified: Indicates whether the library item has been verified.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemMetadataInput$isVerifie: The verification status of the library item
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$isRatedByUser: Whether the current user has rated the library item.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$isVerified: Indicates whether the library item has been verified.
refs.UserAppItem$canEdit: A flag indicating whether the user can edit the Q App.
refs.UserAppItem$isVerified: Indicates whether the Q App has been verified.

Card.base: A card representing a component or step in an Amazon Q App's flow.

CardInput.base: The properties defining an input card in an Amazon Q App.

refs.AppDefinitionInput$cards: The cards that make up the Q App definition.

refs.AppDefinition$cards: The cards that make up the Q App, such as text input, file upload, or query cards.

refs.QQueryCard$outputSource: The source or type of output generated by the query card.
refs.QQueryCardInput$outputSource: The source or type of output to generate for the query card.

CardStatus.base: The current status and value of a card in an active Amazon Q App session.

refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$cardStatus: The current status for each card in the Q App session.

CardValue.base: The value or result associated with a card in a Amazon Q App session.

refs.StartQAppSessionInput$initialValues: Optional initial input values to provide for the Q App session.
refs.UpdateQAppSessionInput$values: The input values to provide for the current state of the Q App session.

refs.CardValue$value: The value or result associated with the card.

refs.ListCategoriesOutput$categories: The categories of a Amazon Q Business application environment instance.

Category.base: A category used to classify and filter library items for Amazon Q Apps.

refs.CreateLibraryItemInput$categories: The categories to associate with the library item for easier discovery.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemInput$categories: The new categories to associate with the library item.

CategoryInput.base: A label that web experience users associate with a library item. Web experience users use Categories to tag and filter library items.

refs.CategoryInput$color: The color of the category, represented as a hexadecimal value of either 3 or 6 digits.

refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$categories: The categories associated with the library item for discovery.
refs.LibraryItemMember$categories: The categories associated with the library item.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$categories: The categories associated with the updated library item.

refs.BatchUpdateCategoryInput$categories: The list of categories to be updated with their new values.

ConflictException.base: The requested operation could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the resource.

ContentTooLargeException.base: The requested operation could not be completed because the content exceeds the maximum allowed size.

ConversationMessage.base: A message in a conversation, used as input for generating an Amazon Q App definition.

refs.ConversationMessage$body: The text content of the conversation message.

refs.CreatePresignedUrlInput$fileContentsSha2: The Base64-encoded SHA-256 digest of the contents of the file to be uploaded.

refs.TextInputCard$defaultValue: The default value to pre-populate in the text input field.
refs.TextInputCardInput$defaultValue: The default value to pre-populate in the text input field.

refs.BatchDeleteCategoryInput$categories: The list of IDs of the categories to be deleted.

refs.FileUploadCard$dependencies: Any dependencies or requirements for the file upload card.
refs.FormInputCard$dependencies: Any dependencies or requirements for the form input card.
refs.QPluginCard$dependencies: Any dependencies or requirements for the plugin card.
refs.QQueryCard$dependencies: Any dependencies or requirements for the query card.
refs.TextInputCard$dependencies: Any dependencies or requirements for the text input card.

refs.CreateQAppInput$description: The description of the new Q App.
refs.CreateQAppOutput$description: The description of the new Q App.
refs.PredictAppDefinition$description: The description of the generated Q App definition.
refs.UpdateQAppInput$description: The new description for the Q App.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$description: The new description of the updated Q App.

refs.QAppSessionData$value: The response submitted for a Q App session.

refs.AttributeFilter$equalsTo: Performs an equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue, longValue, stringListValue and stringValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$containsAll: Returns true when a document contains all the specified document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: stringListValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$containsAny: Returns true when a document contains any of the specified document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: stringListValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$greaterThan: Performs a greater than operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue and longValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$greaterThanOrEquals: Performs a greater than or equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue and longValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$lessThan: Performs a less than operation on two document attributes or metadata fields. Supported for the following document attribute value types: dateValue and longValue.
refs.AttributeFilter$lessThanOrEquals: Performs a less than or equals operation on two document attributes or metadata fields.Supported for the following document attribute value type: dateValue and longValue.

DocumentAttributeValue.base: The value of a document attribute. You can only provide one value for a document attribute.

refs.CreatePresignedUrlInput$scope: Whether the file is associated with a Q App definition or a specific Q App session.
refs.ImportDocumentInput$scope: Whether the file is associated with a Q App definition or a specific Q App session.

refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$status: The current status of the Q App session.

FileUploadCard.base: A card in an Amazon Q App that allows the user to upload a file.

refs.Card$fileUpload: A container for the properties of the file upload card.

FileUploadCardInput.base: Represents a file upload card. It can optionally receive a filename and fileId to set a default file. If not received, the user must provide the file when the Q App runs.

refs.CardInput$fileUpload: A container for the properties of the file upload input card.

refs.CreatePresignedUrlInput$fileName: The name of the file to be uploaded.
refs.FileUploadCardInput$filename: The default filename to use for the file upload card.
refs.ImportDocumentInput$fileName: The name of the file being uploaded.

FormInputCard.base: A card in an Amazon Q App that allows the user to submit a response.

refs.Card$formInput: A container for the properties of the form input card.

FormInputCardInput.base: Represents a form input card for an Amazon Q App.

refs.CardInput$formInput: A container for the properties of the form input card.

FormInputCardMetadata.base: The metadata of the form input card.

refs.FormInputCard$metadata: The metadata that defines the form input card data.
refs.FormInputCardInput$metadata: The metadata that defines the form input card data.

refs.FormInputCardMetadata$schema: The JSON schema that defines the shape of the response data.

refs.AppDefinitionInput$initialPrompt: The initial prompt displayed when the Q App is started.
refs.CreateQAppOutput$initialPrompt: The initial prompt displayed when the Q App is started.
refs.GetQAppOutput$initialPrompt: The initial prompt displayed when the Q App is started.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$initialPrompt: The initial prompt for the updated Q App.

refs.FormInputCard$computeMode: The compute mode of the form input card. This property determines whether individual participants of a data collection session can submit multiple response or one response. A compute mode of append shall allow participants to submit the same form multiple times with different values. A compute mode of replacecode> shall overwrite the current value for each participant.
refs.FormInputCardInput$computeMode: The compute mode of the form input card. This property determines whether individual participants of a data collection session can submit multiple response or one response. A compute mode of append shall allow participants to submit the same form multiple times with different values. A compute mode of replacecode> shall overwrite the current value for each participant.

refs.Category$appCount: The number of published Amazon Q Apps associated with a category
refs.CreateLibraryItemOutput$ratingCount: The number of ratings the library item has received from users.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$ratingCount: The number of ratings the library item has received from users.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$userCount: The number of users who have associated the Q App with their account.
refs.InternalServerException$retryAfterSecond: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the operation
refs.LibraryItemMember$ratingCount: The number of ratings the library item has received.
refs.LibraryItemMember$userCount: The number of users who have the associated Q App.
refs.ThrottlingException$retryAfterSeconds: The number of seconds to wait before retrying the operation
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$ratingCount: The number of ratings the library item has received.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$userCount: The number of users who have the associated Q App.

InternalServerException.base: An internal service error occurred while processing the request.

refs.ListLibraryItemsOutput$libraryItems: The list of library items meeting the request criteria.

LibraryItemMember.base: A library item is a snapshot of an Amazon Q App that can be published so the users in their Amazon Q Apps library can discover it, clone it, and run it.

refs.UpdateLibraryItemInput$status: The new status to set for the library item, such as "Published" or "Hidden".

refs.QQueryCard$memoryReferences: Any dependencies for the query card, where the dependencies are references to the collected responses.

refs.ListLibraryItemsInput$limit: The maximum number of library items to return in the response.
refs.ListQAppsInput$limit: The maximum number of Q Apps to return in the response.

refs.ListLibraryItemsInput$nextToken: The token to request the next page of results.
refs.ListQAppsInput$nextToken: The token to request the next page of results.

PermissionInput.base: The permission to grant or revoke for a Amazon Q App.

refs.PermissionInput$principal: The principal user to which the permission applies.

PermissionOutput.base: The permission granted to the Amazon Q App.

PermissionsOutputList.base: A list of permissions granted for a Amazon Q App.

refs.DescribeQAppPermissionsOutput$permission: The list of permissions granted for the Amazon Q App.
refs.UpdateQAppPermissionsOutput$permissions: The updated list of permissions for the Amazon Q App.

refs.TextInputCard$placeholder: The placeholder text to display in the text input field.
refs.TextInputCardInput$placeholder: The placeholder text to display in the text input field.

refs.QPluginCardInput$pluginId: The unique identifier of the plugin used by the card.

refs.QPluginCard$pluginType: The type or category of the plugin used by the card.

PredictAppDefinition.base: The definition of an Amazon Q App generated based on input such as a conversation or problem statement.

PredictQAppInputOptions.base: The input options for generating an Q App definition.

refs.PredictQAppInput$options: The input to generate the Q App definition from, either a conversation or problem statement.

refs.PredictQAppInputOptions$conversation: A conversation to use as input for generating the Q App definition.

refs.PredictQAppInputOptions$problemStatement: A problem statement to use as input for generating the Q App definition.

refs.CreatePresignedUrlOutput$presignedUrlFie: The form fields to include in the presigned S3 POST operation used to upload a file.

PrincipalOutput.base: The principal for which the permission applies.

refs.PermissionOutput$principal: The principal user to which the permission applies.

refs.PrincipalOutput$email: The email address associated with the user.

refs.QPluginCard$prompt: The prompt or instructions displayed for the plugin card.
refs.QPluginCardInput$prompt: The prompt or instructions displayed for the plugin card.
refs.QQueryCard$prompt: The prompt or instructions displayed for the query card.
refs.QQueryCardInput$prompt: The prompt or instructions displayed for the query card.

QAppSessionData.base: The response collected for a Amazon Q App session. This container represents a single response to a Q App session.

refs.ListQAppSessionDataOutput$sessionData: The collected responses of a Q App session.

refs.CreateLibraryItemOutput$createdAt: The date and time the library item was created.
refs.CreateLibraryItemOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the library item was last updated.
refs.CreatePresignedUrlOutput$presignedUrlExp: The date and time that the presigned URL will expire in ISO 8601 format.
refs.CreateQAppOutput$createdAt: The date and time the Q App was created.
refs.CreateQAppOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the Q App was last updated.
refs.ExportQAppSessionDataOutput$expiresAt: The date and time when the link for the exported Q App session data expires.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$createdAt: The date and time the library item was created.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the library item was last updated.
refs.GetQAppOutput$createdAt: The date and time the Q App was created.
refs.GetQAppOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the Q App was last updated.
refs.LibraryItemMember$createdAt: The date and time the library item was created.
refs.LibraryItemMember$updatedAt: The date and time the library item was last updated.
refs.QAppSessionData$timestamp: The date and time when the session data is submitted.
refs.Submission$timestamp: The date and time when the card is submitted.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$createdAt: The date and time the library item was originally created.
refs.UpdateLibraryItemOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the library item was last updated.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$createdAt: The date and time the Q App was originally created.
refs.UpdateQAppOutput$updatedAt: The date and time the Q App was last updated.
refs.UserAppItem$createdAt: The date and time the user's association with the Q App was created.

QPluginCard.base: A card in an Q App that integrates with a third-party plugin or service.

refs.Card$qPlugin: A container for the properties of the plugin card.

QPluginCardInput.base: The input shape for defining a plugin card in an Amazon Q App.

refs.CardInput$qPlugin: A container for the properties of the plugin input card.

QQueryCard.base: A card in a Amazon Q App that generates a response based on the Amazon Q Business service.

refs.Card$qQuery: A container for the properties of the query card.

QQueryCardInput.base: The input shape for defining a query card in an Amazon Q App.

refs.CardInput$qQuery: A container for the properties of the query input card.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The requested resource could not be found.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.base: The requested operation could not be completed because it would exceed the service's quota or limit.

refs.GetQAppSessionMetadataOutput$sessionName: The name of the Q App session.

refs.UpdateQAppSessionMetadataInput$sessionNa: The new name for the Q App session.

refs.SessionSharingConfiguration$acceptRespon: Indicates whether an Q App session can accept responses from users.

SessionSharingConfiguration.base: The sharing configuration of an Amazon Q App data collection session.

refs.GetQAppSessionMetadataOutput$sharingConf: The sharing configuration of the Q App data collection session.
refs.UpdateQAppSessionMetadataInput$sharingCo: The new sharing configuration for the Q App data collection session.
refs.UpdateQAppSessionMetadataOutput$sharingC: The new sharing configuration of the updated Q App data collection session.

refs.SessionSharingConfiguration$enabled: Indicates whether an Q App session is shareable with other users.

refs.SessionSharingConfiguration$revealCards: Indicates whether collected responses for an Q App session are revealed for all users.

refs.AppDefinition$appDefinitionVersion: The version of the app definition schema or specification.

refs.Category$title: The title or name of the category.

refs.CreatePresignedUrlOutput$presignedUrl: The URL for a presigned S3 POST operation used to upload a file.

refs.CreateQAppOutput$updatedBy: The user who last updated the Q App.

refs.DescribeQAppPermissionsOutput$appId: The unique identifier of the Amazon Q App for which permissions are returned.
refs.ExportQAppSessionDataOutput$csvFileLink: The link where the exported Q App session data can be downloaded from.
refs.ExportQAppSessionDataOutput$sessionArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Q App data collection session.

refs.FileUploadCard$fileId: The unique identifier of the file associated with the card.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$status: The status of the library item, such as "Published".
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$createdBy: The user who created the library item.
refs.GetLibraryItemOutput$updatedBy: The user who last updated the library item.
refs.GetQAppOutput$createdBy: The user who created the Q App.
refs.GetQAppOutput$updatedBy: The user who last updated the Q App.
refs.GetQAppSessionMetadataOutput$sessionArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Q App session.
refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$sessionId: The unique identifier of the Q App session.
refs.GetQAppSessionOutput$sessionArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Q App session.
refs.ImportDocumentInput$fileContentsBase64: The base64-encoded contents of the file to upload.

Submission.base: A record created when a user submits a form card.

refs.CardStatus$submissions: A list of previous submissions, if the card is a form card.

SubmissionMutation.base: Represents an action performed on a submission.

refs.CardValue$submissionMutation: The structure that describes how the current form card value is mutated. Only applies for form cards when multiple responses are allowed.

refs.SubmissionMutation$mutationType: The operation that is performed on a submission.

refs.UntagResourceRequest$tagKeys: The keys of the tags to disassociate from the resource.

refs.CreateQAppInput$tags: Optional tags to associate with the new Q App.
refs.StartQAppSessionInput$tags: Optional tags to associate with the new Q App session.

refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$tags: The list of tags that are assigned to the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$tags: The tags to associate with the resource.

TextInputCard.base: A card in an Amazon Q App that allows the user to input text.

refs.Card$textInput: A container for the properties of the text input card.

TextInputCardInput.base: The input shape for defining a text input card in an Amazon Q App.

refs.CardInput$textInput: A container for the properties of the text input card.

ThrottlingException.base: The requested operation could not be completed because too many requests were sent at once. Wait a bit and try again later.

refs.DocumentAttributeValue$dateValue:
A date expressed as an ISO 8601 string.

It's important for the time zone to be included in the ISO 8601 date-time format. For example, 2012-03-25T12:30:10+01:00 is the ISO 8601 date-time format for March 25th 2012 at 12:30PM (plus 10 seconds) in Central European Time.

UnauthorizedException.base: The client is not authenticated or authorized to perform the requested operation.
